Key Match Events: Scott Edwards scored a fighting 68 to take the Dutch to 229
Paul van Meekeren (7.2-0-23-4) bundled out Bangladesh for just 142 runs in 42.2 overs
Bas de Leede sent back two Bangladesh batters and ran out Mahedi Hasan (7-0-25-2)
Logan van Beek played a cameo of 23 not out from 16 balls (2x4, 1x6) as the Netherlands scored 36 runs in the last three overs
Mustafizur Rahman (2/36) dismissed Wesley Barresi (41) and Scott Edwards at the death
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands bowler Bas de Leede made an outstanding comeback by sending back two Bangladesh batters and running out Mahedi Hasan
Bangladesh made smart bowling changes and their attack looked incisive
Complacency in fielding ensured that the Dutchmen lasted the distance after losing half of the side for 107 runs inside 27 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Scott Edwards overcame an edgy start to score a second World Cup fifty and take them to a modest 229 all out
Bangladesh fielders were not very sharp in Kolkata
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result meant the Netherlands, an associate ICC member, now sit above defending champions England and Bangladesh in the point table

The 39-year-old, who is the only surviving member of the Netherlands side from the 2011 World Cup, started off with a leg-side flick to boundary against Shoriful and followed it up with another boundary in the same over
Taskin, who missed their matches against India and South Africa because of a sore shoulder, dismissed Vikramjit Singh in his opening over
